intro: Newtonia buchananii, commonly known as the African violets, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Newtonia buchananii thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil.
